result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Scepanski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 7 days is granted. TIME SERVED

-Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing on 11-01-2022 and each month thereafter. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 

-Cases 22CM1463 and 21CT672 are dismissed and read-in.

records.addlTxt:
9:20 AM Defendant Andrew J Scepanski in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Andrew J Scepanski.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22CM1463 and 21CT672

Court orders the following:	
7 DAYS Waukesha County Jail
7 DAYS CREDIT
TIME SERVED

Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 until paid in full.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
The bail monies posted will be applied to fine/fee/surcharge in this matter. ($125.00)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
